node.text: Ow, ow. Not so bright. Hi. You here for parts? Need something fixed?
node.choice: Are you a tinker?
You seem very sensitive to light.
Do you mind if I use the rock tumbler?
What are you working on?
Remind me what you want me to find for you again?

choice.CompleteQuestStep: Chaos Theory~Find a dram of warm static
choice.text: I have your static. Take it.

node.choice: Cat said that you two don't get along. What's the story there?
Live and drink.

node.text: =name=! It's great to see you well. Stay a while!
node.choice: How are things with your mutations?
Do you get along with Cat these days?
Live and drink, Bright.

conversation.node: Worth a try. Well, let me know if you change your mind.

node.text: Well, I like to think of myself more like an artificer, but yeah. I'm the tinker here, or at least I fill the role of one.
node.choice: What's the difference between a tinker and artificer?
I had other questions.
Live and drink.

node.text: Eh. Just semantics.
node.choice: I see. Live and drink.

node.text: I am, yes. I wasn't always, but I mutated albinism at some point, and it's been getting worse since. Sunlight will burn me, and even a torch is enough to hurt my eyes. There's a reason I keep my workshop dark.
node.choice: I see. Live and drink.

node.text: Help yourself, just make sure you clean up. We keep it busy and I'm not liable for any missing gems if you leave them in there. Similarly, anything you find in there is all yours.
node.choice: Thank you. Live and drink.

node.text: Oh, y'know, a bit of this and a bit of that. Hey, actually, are you looking for work right now?
node.choice: Maybe. What did you have in mind?
Not at the moment.

node.text: So, for obvious reasons, I can't really go out much. Well, I could, but I very much don't like being in the habit of spending hours at a time out in the sun when just holding a torch is enough to hurt my eyes. I'm looking to fix that, and I need someone else to help me.
node.choice: I'm listening.
That sounds a bit too heavy for me.

node.text: There's a certain type of liquid I've heard of. Very entropic. I've done some asking, and I think I might be able to make use of it. If you can get me a dram of it, I could test my theory.
node.choice: What kind of liquid am I looking for?
That sounds a bit too heavy for me.

node.text: I've heard it called warm static. Dilute won't do; I'll need it in pure form. Just a dram is enough. I'll compensate you for your work.
node.choice: Alright. I'll track down your static. Where should I start looking?
How will this help your problems with light?
What kind of compensation?
Entropic liquid? I'll have to pass.

node.text: I'd rather not go into detail on that just yet. Just rest assured that it won't cause any harm to anyone.
node.choice: This all seems a bit much. Maybe another time.

node.text: I happen to have a bit of a knack for item modding. I like collecting different designs, and I copy them onto disks myself. If you can help me with this, I'll be more than happy to help you learn a few designs - anything you have in mind, I've probably got.
node.choice: Entropic liquid? I'll have to pass.

node.text:
Great! Thank you so much. I'm afraid I'm not actually wholly sure where to find the stuff, but I have some leads. Unfortunately, neither of them are great.
The liquid evidently originates from the Moon Stair, but that's probably not a place you want to be. I hear that the alchemist in Bethesda Susa is an expert in this sort of thing, but that requires finding them, which is easier said than done. I would try to find the alchemist first, and if that fails, you can try to get it straight from the source.
Should you brave the Moon Stair, you will be searching for a certain type of jell. The warm static is harvested from its body - it may take several attempts, and if you use light-based weaponry like lasers, I suspect it will be destroyed outright.
Be careful. I have never been to the Moon Stair, but I have heard stories. Stay away unless you have no other choice. And when you obtain the liquid, do NOT pour it onto anything. Bring it directly here.
node.choice: While I'm here, I had other questions.
I guess I'd better start looking. Live and drink.

node.text: A highly entropic liquid, called warm static. For reasons I'm still working on, I believe it may be able to help me tolerate the light again. It originates from the Moon Stair, and if you have no other options, I believe you could source it from a certain type of ooze that occurs there. A much safer idea would be to find the alchemist, in Bethesda Susa. I only need a dram, but it needs to be pure - if it's dilute or otherwise contaminated, it won't work for my purposes.
node.choice: Thanks. Live and drink.

node.text:
{{emote|*Bright convulses on the ground. In showers of dust, =pronouns.possessive= extra arms warp and dematerialize. =pronouns.Possessive= skin flickers and begins to glow.*}}
{{emote|*You're about to run and get help when =pronouns.possessive= convulsion stops. =pronouns.Subjective= unsteadily sits up.*}}
node.choice: ...Bright?

node.text:
I...
It worked.
It worked!
{{emote|*=pronouns.Subjective= bolts past you, heading south.*}}
node.choice: *catch up with =pronouns.objective=*

node.text:
{{emote|*Bright is staring at the sky with a foolish grin.*}}
It was risky, but it worked. My eyes don't hurt anymore! My skin doesn't prickle! I haven't felt this good in years, =name=. You've done me a favor I can never repay.
Like I promised, the least I can do is teach you some of my designs. I'll get you some mod disks, free of charge. You're welcome at my door any time.
Thank you.

choice.text: You're welcome. Live and drink, Bright.

node.text:
Much better, thanks to you! I uh, seem to have mostly lost my sense of pain, which is both a good and bad thing given my occupation. I also miss my other two arms, but I'm getting used to things without them.
More than anything, though, I'm just so glad to be able to go outside again. I've missed it so badly.
node.choice: I'm glad to hear. Live and drink.

node.text: It's complicated. That's kind of, y'know, personal. I'm not sure I'm keen on opening up to someone I just met.
node.choice: Understandable. Live and drink.

node.text:
Well, Cat and I used to... well. We were very close. She became a lot harder to talk when she took on the mantle of warden, and we gradually stopped talking to each other. We were cold for a long time, and with how miserable I was in the sunlight, I rarely ever interacted with her. I guess there was some resentment.
Now that I can go outside again properly, I see Cat a lot more. I think she's starting to warm up again; the other day she even laughed at a joke I made. It isn't much, but I'm glad to be on talking terms with her again.
node.choice: Hopefully it works out. Live and drink.
